title: How to Make Miniature Chocolate Cones

steps.headline: Make parchment cones.
steps.description: Draw ten circles on parchment paper that measure 7.5cm (3 inches). Cut out each of the circles. Form the circles into cone shapes, securing each one with a piece of tape. Keep the cones evenly sized so that they will all turn out roughly the same size.

steps.headline: Break the chocolate into small pieces.
steps.description: Place the pieces into a bain marie or double boiler. Heat to melt the chocolate, stirring as it melts to hasten the melting.

steps.headline: Remove the melted chocolate from the heat.
Brush the melted chocolate onto the inside of a parchment cone.
steps.description: Use a fine pastry brush or a small, new artist's brush to do this. Seek to make the coating even all the way around and cover all of the inside of the cone, to the top.

steps.headline: Add a second layer of melted chocolate inside each cone.
steps.description: You may need to melt the chocolate again if you haven't worked swiftly enough, that's okay, just melt as explained earlier.

steps.headline: Place the chocolate cones onto a baking sheet or tray.
steps.description: Place into the refrigerator to chill and set. This should be for a minimum of 2 hours.

steps.headline: Remove from the refrigerator.
steps.description: Peel off the parchment paper, doing so very carefully. The chocolate cones are now ready. You can either fill them with a filling of your own choice, use them as they are or use the suggested filling from the next section of this article.

steps.headline: Tip the cream, confectioner's sugar and liqueur or fruit juice into a mixing bowl.
Whisk or beat until the whole mixture thickens.
Transfer to a piping bag in readiness for using.
steps.description: If you don't have a piping bag, use a pastry bag or snip the end off a plastic bag.

parts.name: Adding the filling to the chocolate cones

steps.headline: Pipe the whipped cream mixture into each cone.
steps.description: Be sure to distribute the amount of cream evenly between each cone.

steps.headline: Add sprinkles on top of each cone for decoration.
steps.description: This step is optional and other items can be used instead, if preferred.

steps.headline: Place in the refrigerator to chill.
steps.description: Allow to chill for 1 to 2 hours before serving, or leave until needed. It's a good idea to transfer to an airtight container if chilling for more than 2 hours.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: The chocolate cones can be arranged on a plate for guests to help themselves to, or added as a garnish to any dessert dish that you've made.

text: Making the chocolate cones Make parchment cones. Draw ten circles on parchment paper that measure 7.5cm (3 inches). Cut out each of the circles. Form the circles into cone shapes, securing each one with a piece of tape. Keep the cones evenly sized so that they will all turn out roughly the same size. Break the chocolate into small pieces. Place the pieces into a bain marie or double boiler. Heat to melt the chocolate, stirring as it melts to hasten the melting. Remove the melted chocolate from the heat.  Brush the melted chocolate onto the inside of a parchment cone. Use a fine pastry brush or a small, new artist's brush to do this. Seek to make the coating even all the way around and cover all of the inside of the cone, to the top. Repeat for each cone.  Add a second layer of melted chocolate inside each cone. You may need to melt the chocolate again if you haven't worked swiftly enough, that's okay, just melt as explained earlier. Place the chocolate cones onto a baking sheet or tray. Place into the refrigerator to chill and set. This should be for a minimum of 2 hours. Remove from the refrigerator. Peel off the parchment paper, doing so very carefully. The chocolate cones are now ready. You can either fill them with a filling of your own choice, use them as they are or use the suggested filling from the next section of this article. Making the filling Tip the cream, confectioner's sugar and liqueur or fruit juice into a mixing bowl.  Whisk or beat until the whole mixture thickens.  Transfer to a piping bag in readiness for using. If you don't have a piping bag, use a pastry bag or snip the end off a plastic bag. Adding the filling to the chocolate cones Pipe the whipped cream mixture into each cone. Be sure to distribute the amount of cream evenly between each cone. Add sprinkles on top of each cone for decoration. This step is optional and other items can be used instead, if preferred. Place in the refrigerator to chill. Allow to chill for 1 to 2 hours before serving, or leave until needed. It's a good idea to transfer to an airtight container if chilling for more than 2 hours. Serve. The chocolate cones can be arranged on a plate for guests to help themselves to, or added as a garnish to any dessert dish that you've made.
